title: Andrew Sutherland (mathematician)
summary: Andrew Victor Sutherland is an American mathematician and Principal Research Scientist at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.[1]  His research focuses on computational aspects of number theory and arithmetic geometry.[1] He is known for his contributions to several projects involving large scale computations, including the Polymath project on bounded gaps between primes,[2][3][4][5][6] the L-functions and Modular Forms Database,[7][8] the sums of three cubes project,[9][10][11] and the computation and classification of Sato-Tate distributions.[12][13][14][15]
